item.title: Advent of Code 2023
item.description:
Doing the Advent of Code this year is an escapist activity I have on hand. This blog post is being written in the middle of the 2023 Israel-Hamas war. I’m mostly doing reserve duty, but if I find free time here and there, I think it’s a good idea to solve a few puzzles.

Hey, Better than doomscrolling, right?

Let’s turn off Co-Pilot

Eric says:

(If you want to use AI to help you solve puzzles, I can’t really stop you, but I feel like it’s harder to get better at programming if you ask an AI to do the programming for you.)

item.title: Bluehat Il 2020
item.description:
Theme is wierd, I was in the red side

Day 1

Intro

Every year we pick a theme. Last year was privacy - offensive cyber, use of technology to violate human rights. But MicroSoft has no problem selling infrastructure to NSO. Hmmm….

Theme for this year:

Differences and similarities

Keeping Windows Secure

Keeping windows secure is hard:

  1. 5.7 Million source code files
  2. 1100 PR per day
  3. 3,600 developer commiting to windows
  4. 440 official branches

Windows is evolving: PCs, XBOX, IOT, Hololens, Cloud. If same code runs on different environment, the security model changes. Example: DirectX.

item.title: Scoutsuite Exploratory Surgery
item.description:
Setup

I set up the following machines, and I’m debugging Directly from PyCharm using remote SSH shell:

  • An AWS machine with Full Admin IAM role. i-05c3679394ad7c6d5
  • An Azure machine with the Reader role b95047a4-b17a-4a39-8b03-901dc475c046

Conclusions

Installations

There are quite a lot of extra dependencies this bestows on the Monkey (mostly cloud stuff)).

First execution - AWS

Went with AWS. Ran using Python 3.7 - python3.7 scout.py aws. This means we need to know ahead of time which provider we are planning to scan and pass the parameter accordingly.
